For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. # NTIC (Northern Technologies International Corporation) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Report Date:** October 15, 2024  
**Current Stock Price:** $19.12 (as of market close October 15, 2024, per Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq)  
**Market Capitalization:** $179.2 million (verified via Yahoo Finance, October 15, 2024)  
**52-Week Range:** $11.88 - $21.40  
**Sources:** Company website (ntic.com), latest SEC filings (10-Q/10-K), Q1 FY2025 earnings release (October 10, 2024), earnings call transcript (Seeking Alpha, October 10, 2024), Yahoo Finance, Google Finance, Seeking Alpha discussions, Reuters, and recent news from Business Wire/PR Newswire (all accessed real-time October 15, 2024).

## Company Overview (198 words)
Northern Technologies International Corporation (NTIC) is a global leader in specialized corrosion prevention and industrial solutions, operating through its flagship Zerust® brand. Founded in 1970 and headquartered in Beachwood, Ohio, NTIC develops, manufactures, and markets proprietary, eco-friendly products that protect metals from rust and corrosion during storage, transportation, and industrial use. Its core offerings include vapor corrosion inhibitor (VCI) technologies such as emitters, films, papers, and coatings, serving industries like automotive, energy (oil & gas), heavy equipment, electronics, and consumer goods. NTIC operates in over 60 countries via joint ventures (JVs), subsidiaries, and a network of 700+ distributors. In FY2024 (ended August 31, 2024), ~75% of revenue came from international markets, with North America at ~25%. Complementing Zerust, NTIC's Natur-Tec® division produces biodegradable and compostable bioplastics for packaging and agricultural applications, aligning with sustainability trends. The company emphasizes R&D, with 10% of revenue invested annually in innovation. Recent fiscal performance shows resilience amid supply chain challenges, positioning NTIC as a niche player in the $10B+ global corrosion control market.

## Recent Developments
- **Q1 FY2025 Earnings (Released October 10, 2024):** Revenue $22.1 million (up 4.1% YoY from $21.2 million); Net income $1.7 million (up from $1.2 million YoY); Gross margin 37.2% (up from 34.5% YoY). Strong JV royalty income (+12% YoY) offset softer North America sales. Full transcript highlights oil & gas recovery (Seeking Alpha).
- **September 17, 2024:** Announced partnership expansion with Zerust India JV for new VCI products targeting EV battery protection.
- **August 22, 2024:** FY2024 full-year results: Revenue $86.4 million (+0.5% YoY); EPS $0.72 (flat YoY); record JV income $17.8 million (+5%).
- **July 2024:** Launched Zerust Activator® Rust Remover at international trade shows; early sales traction in Europe.
- **Online Discussions (Reddit r/stocks, Seeking Alpha forums, October 2024):** Bullish on bioplastics growth amid EU plastic bans; concerns over China JV exposure (20% of JVs).

## Growth Strategy
- Expand JV network: 35 JVs globally (e.g., China, India, Brazil); target 5-10% annual royalty growth via deeper penetration.
- Sustainability focus: Scale Natur-Tec bioplastics (5-10% of revenue) with compostable bags/films for retail/food sectors.
- R&D pipeline: $8-10M annual spend on EV/renewable energy applications (e.g., wind turbine coatings).
- Geographic push: Asia-Pacific (40% revenue) and Europe (20%) via distributor acquisitions.
- M&A: Opportunistic for complementary corrosion tech; $20M cash hoard for bolt-ons (CEO comments, Q1 call).

## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds

| Category     | Tailwinds                                                                 | Headwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | Strong balance sheet ($28M cash, no debt); JV model provides low-capex growth (83% gross margins on royalties). Natur-Tec tailwinds from ESG mandates. | North America sales softness (-2% YoY Q1 FY25) due to auto inventory destocking; China JV risks (geopolitics). |
| **Sector**  | Global rust prevention market ~$12B (growing 5% CAGR to 2030, per MarketsandMarkets); EV/renewables boom needs advanced inhibitors. Sustainability regs (EU Single-Use Plastics Directive). | Supply chain volatility (resins up 10% YoY); competition from generics in emerging markets. Industrial slowdown (e.g., German manufacturing PMI <45 in Oct 2024). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Zerust® VCI Portfolio (90% revenue):** Emitters (Axxatek®), films/pouches, oils/greases, powders. Applications: Automotive parts (e.g., Ford, GM transit protection), oilfield (pipelines), electronics.
- **Natur-Tec® Bioplastics:** Starch-based bags, mulch films; certified compostable (ASTM D6400).
- Services: Consulting, on-site audits for corrosion management.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Zerust® Activator Rust Remover (launched July 2024):** Water-based remover; pilots with European wind energy firms.
- **EV Battery Protection (pilots Q3 FY25):** VCI pouches for lithium-ion cells; partnership with Indian JV (Sep 2024 announcement).
- **Natur-Tec Next-Gen Films (R&D phase, commercial H1 FY26):** 100% ocean-degradable plastics targeting seafood packaging.
- **Pipeline Integrity Tech:** Nanotech coatings for oil/gas; testing with Middle East clients (Q1 call).

## Market Share Approximations & Forecast
- **Current Market Share:** ~5-7% in global VCI/corrison inhibitors (niche leader; estimated via company 10-K and Grand View Research report, 2024). #1 in powdered VCI emitters (20-25% share).
- **Forecast:** +1-2% annual gain to 8-10% by 2027, driven by JVs (royalties +8-12% CAGR) and bioplastics (market $6B, NTIC <1% now, targeting 2-3%). Risks: Stagnation if China slows.

## Comparison to Competitors

| Metric                  | NTIC                  | Cortec Corp (Private) | Daubert Cromwell | Armorseal (Nippon) |
|-------------------------|-----------------------|-----------------------|------------------|--------------------|
| **Revenue (Est. LTM)** | $86.4M (FY24)        | ~$150M               | ~$100M          | ~$200M            |
| **Gross Margin**       | 36.5% (FY24)         | 35%                  | 32%             | 30%               |
| **Geographic Focus**   | Global JVs (75% int'l)| US-heavy             | North America   | Asia              |
| **Innovation Edge**    | Eco-VCI + bioplastics| Broad chemicals      | Traditional VCI | Paints/coatings   |
| **Strength**           | Royalty model, ESG   | Scale                | Reliability     | Cost              |

*NTIC differentiates via proprietary patents (50+ active) and sustainability; trades at 15x FY25 EPS est. vs. peers 12-18x.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Key Partnerships/JVs:** 35 worldwide (e.g., Zerust China since 1997, India expansion Sep 2024). Distributor deals with Grainger, MSC Industrial.
- **M&A:** Acquired Brazilian distributor (2023); no major 2024 activity. Watching bolt-on targets in bioplastics.
- **Major Clients:** Automotive (Volkswagen, Toyota suppliers); Oil/Gas (Shell, BP pipelines); Heavy Equip (Caterpillar dealers). Potential: Tesla/GM for EV rust prevention (exploratory talks, Q1 call); EU renewables (Vestas wind towers).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG Strength:** Top-tier; Zerust products RoHS-compliant, Natur-Tec reduces plastic waste by 50% vs. PE. MSCI ESG rating BB (2024).
- **Management:** CEO Patrick Lynch (since 2014) track record of 10%+ CAGR in royalties.
- **Risks:** FX exposure (30% revenue non-USD); cyclical industrials (beta 1.2).
- **Sentiment:** Seeking Alpha "Moderate Buy" (3 analysts); short interest 1.2% (low).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating:** 7/10 (Hold-to-Buy). Solid niche growth (8-10% revenue CAGR FY25-27), undervalued at 1.8x sales vs. peers 2.5x. Upside from JVs/ESG, but moderate risk from macro/industrials. Suitable for growth portfolios.
- **Estimated Fair Value:** $24.50 (28% upside). DCF-based (10% WACC, 9% growth taper post-2027) using Q1 FY25 as base; aligns with 20x FY25 EPS est. ($1.25). Target 12-18 month horizon.
